meanings.definition: A person who enjoys listening to or dancing to pop music.
meanings.sent1: The bopper was always the first one on the dance floor when a pop song played.
meanings.sent2: She is known as a dedicated bopper who never misses a pop music concert.
meanings.sent3: The bopper's playlist is filled with catchy pop tunes to keep the party going.
meanings.sent4: Her love for pop music makes her a true bopper at heart.
meanings.sent5: The bopper's enthusiasm for pop music is contagious to everyone around.

meanings.definition: A quick, light blow or punch.
meanings.sent1: He gave the bully a bopper on the arm to defend himself.
meanings.sent2: The playful bopper on the shoulder made her giggle.
meanings.sent3: The pillow fight turned into a friendly exchange of boppers.
meanings.sent4: His bopper to the jaw caught the opponent off guard in the boxing match.
meanings.sent5: The bopper from the balloon sword fight left a temporary mark on his cheek.

meanings.definition: A type of fishing lure designed to attract fish by creating noise or movement in the water.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman used a bopper to lure the fish towards his boat.
meanings.sent2: The shiny bopper in the water caught the attention of the hungry fish.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman's favorite bopper always brought in the biggest catch of the day.
meanings.sent4: The bopper danced on the surface, tempting the fish to take a bite.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman's skillful use of the bopper led to a successful fishing trip.
